function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Reliability of social media sentiment as a data source for health research","Impact":"Misinterpretation of social media sentiment may lead to inaccurate health research findings and interventions","Mitigation":"Verification of social media sentiment with external data sources, such as manual-administered loneliness scales and nationally-representative data","Technologies":"Machine learning models for sentiment analysis","People":"Social media users, health researchers","Owner":"Health research institutions"},{"Description":"Machine learning model training based on social media posts","Impact":"Potential misidentification of individuals and their mental health status, leading to misinformed interventions","Mitigation":"Validation of predictive model results with manual assessment and clinical data","Technologies":"Supervised machine learning models","People":"Social media users, mental health professionals","Owner":"Research institutions, mental health organizations"}]}
